text: Cymbula safiana, common name the saffian limpet, is a species of sea snail, a true limpet, a marine gastropod mollusk in the family Patellidae, one of the families of true limpets.Bouchet, P. (2014). Cymbula safiana (Lamarck, 1819). Accessed through: World Register of Marine Species at http://www.marinespecies.org/aphia.php?p=taxdetails&id;=456662 on 2014-10-31 ==Description== The size of the shell varies between 25 mm and 120 mm. ==Distribution== This marine species has a wide distribution ranging from the Mediterranean Sea to Angola ==References== * Nakano T. & Ozawa T. (2007). Worldwide phylogeography of limpets of the order Patellogastropoda: molecular, morphological and paleontological evidence. Journal of Molluscan Studies 73(1): 79–99. ==External links== * Category:Patellidae Category:Molluscs described in 1771
title: Cymbula safiana
